headline.main: Gee Stymies Colorado to Help Prevent a Four-Game Sweep

docs.snippet: Tom Seaver won games as a reliever and as a starter on the same day in 1984; one of the games, resumed after being suspended the previous night, was the longest in major league history....
docs.lead_paragraph: Tom Seaver won games as a reliever and as a starter on the same day in 1984; one of the games, resumed after being suspended the previous night, was the longest in major league history.
docs.abstract: Legendary pitcher Tom Seaver won games as a reliever and as a starter on the same day in 1984; one of the games, between the Chicago White Sox and Milwaukee Brewers, was suspended after 17 innings because of an American League curfew rule that existed at the time, and resumed the next day; Harold Baines won it for the White Sox, 7-6, with a home run in the bottom of the 25th inning, making it the longest game--by time--in major league history.

headline.main: Seaver’s Double Duty for the White Sox
headline.print_headline: One Pitcher, One Day, Two Roles, Two Wins
